content: No test case indicating that a door can appear on the left side while having a wall on the right side ("      |")  but validator 1 has that case.  This leads to possible reduced points in reverse mode. A point of a validator is to prevent hardcoding by testing the same case not introduce new circumstances not seen in the tests

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Straight-forward.
Test-cases and validators are clear.
Creative and unique (compared to many other clash puzzles)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Some traps to deal with.
Many ways to solve ithe puzzle.
Not too abstract thanks to the input visualization.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I approve this puzzle because it can let play with two-dimensionnal arrays, loops, ternaries and fallbacks.

Please mention that
• Walls are denoted using the characters {{+}}, {{-}} and {{|}}.
• Corners are always {{+}}. (You may add this in front of "Doors can't be placed in a corner".)

Thanks.
Thanks for the feedback :). Updated as suggested.
